summary: The National Airport Supersonic Readiness Act of 2025 mandates the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to study the preparedness of major U.S. airports for high-speed aircraft (supersonic and hypersonic). The study will assess runway length, ground equipment, air traffic control, environmental regulations, and economic factors. The FAA must submit a report to Congress with findings, recommendations for improvements, and cost estimates within a year of enactment.
